meanings.definition: A pattern on clothing or equipment for concealment in natural surroundings.
meanings.sent1: The soldier wore camos to blend in with the forest.
meanings.sent2: Hunters often wear camos to hide from animals.
meanings.sent3: The camos on the jacket made the hiker look like a tree!
meanings.sent4: Her camos were like a secret code that only nature could understand.
meanings.sent5: The camos on the backpack were so realistic, it was hard to spot in the bushes.

meanings.definition: To disguise or hide by blending in with surroundings.
meanings.sent1: The chameleon can camos itself to match any background.
meanings.sent2: She tried to camos her nervousness by smiling brightly.
meanings.sent3: The spy camosed as a waiter to eavesdrop on the conversation.
meanings.sent4: He camosed his true intentions behind a friendly demeanor.
meanings.sent5: The criminal camosed in the crowd to avoid detection by the police.
